snippet: UnitedHealth says it will continue offering some of the popular consumer protections required by the federal health care law, even if the Supreme Court strikes down the entire law later this month.
abstract: UnitedHealth Group says it will continue offering some of the popular consumer protections required by the federal health care law, even if the Supreme Court strikes down the entire law in June.
lead_paragraph: UnitedHealth says it will continue offering some of the popular consumer protections required by the federal health care law, even if the Supreme Court strikes down the entire law later this month.

headline.seo: UnitedHealth to Offer Protections in Health Law Even if It Is Struck Down
headline.main: Health Law Ruling Won’t Alter Plans by Insurer
headline.print_headline: Health Law Ruling Won’t Alter Plans By Insurer
